column2: Cities within the Kingdom can only be chartered by (be vassals of) the King.
This would describe it if it was a true story..
The $JOB$ title is no longer hereditary\n
Has the same religion as the Liege
Has different religion than the Liege
Is not a potential friend of §Y$WHO$§!
The $ROOT_CHARACTERTITLE$ has called for a $CRUSADE_NAME$ to take §Y$PROVINCE$§! from the §Y$TOPOWNERFULLNAME$§!!
Is NOT secretly following another religion\n
Does not have the character flag
Do not have the global flag
Had dynasty flag '§Y$FLAG$§!' for less than §Y$DAYS$§! days
Had dynasty flag '§Y$FLAG$§!' for at least §Y$DAYS$§! days
Does have the $FLAG|Y$ flag on any feature
Does not have the $FLAG|Y$ flag on any feature
Does not have the Bloodline flag:
You can no longer appoint army leaders\n
You can now appoint army leaders\n
You can no longer nominate Regents\n
You can not afford this ship. You need at least $COST$ ¤
Do you wish to offer an Alliance to $COUNTRY$. Doing so will oblige us to assist each other in times of war.
$ACTOR$ offers us an Alliance. By doing so we are promising to help each other in times of war.
Do you wish to request right for our merchants to cross the lands of $RECIPIENT$?
Assassinate a character of your or anybody else's court
We have caught an assassin from $ACTOR$, he $SUCCESS$ in murdering $TARGET$. \n What shall we do with him?
Do you wish to send §Y$ASSASSIN$§! to assassinate §Y$TARGET$§!?\nIt might do us good to be rid of him but, if discovered, we could draw the condemnation of his friends and allies.
We have a slightly tarnished reputation.
We have a rather bad reputation.
We have a very bad reputation
We have an extremely bad reputation.
We are worse than dishonorable scum.
We are hated throughout the entire world.
They have a slightly tarnished reputation.
They have a rather bad reputation.
They have a very bad reputation
They have an extremely bad reputation.
They are worse than dishonorable scum.
They are hated throughout the entire world.
Offer the Barbarians lands as our Client state.

Shall we offer the barbarians $NAME$ the land that they now hold, to rule in our name? \n This will create the new country of $COUNTRY$ in the counties $LIST$. $COUNTRY$ shall pay tribute to us and be our ally.
Offer money for the barbarians to return home.
Shall we offer the barbarians $NAME$ the amount of $CASH$¤ to return whence they came.
Offer the barbarians land to settle on.
Shall we offer the barbarians $NAME$ rights to settle in $LIST$? The barbarians would disband and settle as Freemen farmers. This might also impact the cultural makeup of the county.
Demand that the barbarians surrender unconditionally
Shall we demand that the barbarians $NAME$ immediately lay down their arms, return their stolen property and submit themselves as our slaves?
Do you wish to cancel the Alliance with $COUNTRY$. This will upset them.
They have a truce with your enemies
Call on your partner to aid you in this conflict.
Do you wish to call upon your Allies in these times of war?
The nation of $COUNTRY$, your faithful ally, is requesting that you come to their aid in the conflict against $LIST$.
Dissolving the current Alliance will, of course, end the current Alliance you have with this country, and will adversely affect relations.
Cancel our Military Access to their country.
$COUNTRY$ is canceling the military access they gave us. Our soldiers are no longer allowed on their lands
Do you wish to cancel the military access given to us by $COUNTRY$? Doing so will prevent our troops from accessing their country and ports.
$COUNTRY$ has declared that their troops are leaving our lands and will not return, at least not as friends...
Do you wish to cancel the trade access we give to $RECIPIENT$? \n This will stop their merchants from trespassing on our lands
Canceling a traderoute will remove beneficial effects from the trading counties. It might also upset our foreign trading partners
He had §Y$US$§! men and faced §Y$THEM$§! under §Y$ENEMY$§!. He lost §Y$OUR_LOSSES$§!, while inflicting §Y$THEIR_LOSSES$§! on the enemy.
He had §Y$US$§! ships and faced §Y$THEM$§! under §Y$ENEMY$§!. He lost §Y$OUR_LOSSES$§!, while inflicting §Y$THEIR_LOSSES$§! on the enemy.
You cannot imprison foreign dignitaries once they have been allowed into the country.
Die roll for this side in this phase.
Relative modifier from martial value of commanding leader compared to the opponent's commanding leader.
Are you sure you want to select $IDEA$? Replacing this idea later might incur a stability penalty.
Breach! With a breach in the walls the besieging armies have a much better chance of storming this fortification!
The city can hold out for years.
The city will probably surrender within twelve months.
The city will probably surrender within nine months.
The city will probably surrender within six months.
The city will probably surrender within three months.
The city will surrender any day now.
$SIZE$ ship(s) with pirates will appear in $WHERE$.\n
$SIZE$ regiment(s) rises up in revolt in $WHERE$.\n
There are also $SIZE$ units queued for production in this county.
$MONARCHTITLE$, an envoy of $COUNTRY$ has brought forward a declaration of war. He says our capital will burn within the week!

Declaring war is, sometimes, the last resort of diplomacy. The act of declaring war will reduce the view other countries have of you, especially if you do not have a legitimate reason to do so. It may also reduce your stability. Are you sure you wish to do this?
$MONARCHTITLE$, an envoy of country informs us that they will no longer pay tribute to us. \n Such Insolence!
To demand Tribute you must have a relation of at least -150 and we must both be at peace.
Attempt to desecrate a holy site and damage the religious prestige of a county.
Do you wish to desecrate a holy site in §Y$PROV$§!? This will have a negative effect on the prestige of §Y$RELIGION$§! there.\n$EFFECT$ for $TIME$ days.
A holy shrine in $TARGET$ have been desecrated. \n We caught the foreigner who did it, $NAME$. What shall we do with him?
$NAME$ is already on a mission.\nHe will return on $DATE$.
We have a diplomat enroute, he will arrive on $DATE$

If a general can successfully stiffen the discipline of the units on the flanks of his army he can launch a devastating attack on the enemy. If their flanks give way then the whole army could collapse
Battles ebb and flow, but if a general can raise the troops for a heroic assault on the enemy line then the battle could turn.

A less then friendly power has used agents to identify important people in this county who are unhappy with our rule. They have then funnelled money to these people so that they can turn this unhappiness into action. The revolt risk is now slightly higher.
The type of government changes to $GOV$
Have an army of at least
Have a navy of at least
Have a unit with a leader
Have at least one empty neighboring county
Have at least one owned neighboring county
Have no units with a leader
Sometimes a charismatic general can appeal to launch an appeal to the troops to stand firm in the face in the enemy. This will help the troop resist the attacks of the enemy.
$WHERE$ will $DIRECTION$ a part of the Holy Roman Empire.\n
You can not ask for Military Access when you are at war.
Will no longer be an Elector.\n
A §Y$TYPE$§! will be fielded here on §Y$DATE$§!.
Do you wish to request Military Access from $COUNTRY$ thereby allowing our ships and armies access to their territories?
$COUNTRY$ is requesting Military Access from us. Accepting will allow them to move ships and armies into our territory.
We do not have any special task at this time.
You can not negotiate separate peace between two junior partners in a war.
A state paying tribute is not free to declare war on other states.
We cannot cancel our tribute while we have a truce.
If a country accepts our Alliance offer it may come to our come to our assistance during wars.
Enable them to station troops and ships in our country.
Do you wish to give Military Access to $COUNTRY$? This will enable them to station troops in our territories and ports.
$COUNTRY$ is offering us military access to their country. This would mean that our troops gain free access to their lands, however it also means we cannot declare war on them.
Suggest that we pay tribute to them.
$MONARCHTITLE$, an envoy of country informs us that our tribute no longer interests them. \n Nice to be rid of the burden, but we must watch our step
Do you wish to offer $COUNTRY$ a sum of $CASH$¤ each month in tribute for some peace of mind?
$COUNTRY$ proposes to pay us a tribute of $CASH$¤ each month. If we accept, they will be considered to be under our protection.
It is on the move towards §Y$DEST$§!.
This Centre of Trade is worth a total of §Y$TOTAL$§!¤ each year. Our §Y$NUM$§! merchants are taking in §Y$VALUE$§!¤ of this.
When our §Y$NUM$§! additional merchants arrive, our profits should increase. \n The first one will arrive on $DATE$.
This navy currently $COMMANDER$ and is located in §Y$PROV$§!.
$WHO$ will pay tribute of $WHAT$ gold a month.
\n(This deal is better than what we can expect, refusing it would cause great turmoil in our country.)
\n(This deal is better than what they will expect, and if they refuse it, it will cause great turmoil in their country.)
This port provides a safe haven for ships.
There are $SIZE$ units in the queue.
Sometimes combat is just too much for a man, even the hardiest veteran can suddenly reach his limit. However a charismatic commander can rally dispirited troops giving the whole army a moral bonus.
An envoy from §Y$ACTOR$§! is requesting the release of our 'guest', §Y$NAME$§! for the sum of §Y$CASH$§!¤. \n What should we do?
Pay to have a prisoner they keep released
Do you wish to try to get §Y$PRISONER$§! released for the sum of §Y$CASH$§!¤?
The relation is already so good that it will not be increasing unless through some extraordinary actions.
The relation value represents how two regimes feel about each other, from §R-200§! (hatred) to §G200§! (harmony)
The current state of our diplomatic relations
Release a prisoner back to his homeland
Do you wish to release $NAME$ back to $COUNTRY$?
$WHO$ will no longer be governor of $WHERE$.\n
Revoke their ability to station troops and ships in our country.
Do you wish to revoke the Military Access given to $COUNTRY$? Doing so will prevent their troops from accessing our country and ports.
Convince Governor to join you, taking his county with him
Governor $GOVNAME$ of $TARGET$ reports that he captured the agent $NAME$ of $ACTOR$. $NAME$ was trying to convince the governor to betray us. \n What shall we do with $NAME$?
No governor to seduce, if you want the county take it up with its ruler.

Do you wish to attempt to seduce the governor, §Y$NAME$§!, of §Y$PROV$§!? \n If you are successful he can bring his county over to us, but it will also have dire consequences for our relation with §Y$OWNER$§!
A barbarian horde of $SIZE$ units will spawn in $WHERE$.\n
A state paying tribute is not free to ally with anyone except their masters.
A state paying tribute can not receive tribute
The peasants of $TARGET$ have be incited to near rebellion. \n We caught the foreigner who did it, $NAME$. What shall we do with him?
Do you wish to support the rebels in §Y$PROV$§!?\n$EFFECT$ for $TIME$ days.
Sets the $GROUP$ focus on this advance, increasing the chance of new discoveries by §Y$CHANCE$%§!
The number of revolt fraction is less than
The number of revolt fraction is more than
The number of revolts are less than
The number of revolts are more than
Diplomatic ties are deals between two regimes. For example, Alliances and Military Access treaties
An envoy from $ACTOR$ is requesting that their merchants shall be allowed passage across our lands. \n What shall be our answer?
We wish to trade $GOODS$ from $PROV$ to $PROV_OTHER$ giving $GOODS_OTHER$ in return.
Creating a trade route will, in addition to generating money, give the benefits of the goods being traded to both counties.

$COUNTRY$ is offering us a trade between $FROM$($FROM_GOODS$) and $TO$($TO_GOODS$).
 This will earn each of us $CASH$¤ per month.
 Effect on $FROM$: $FROM_EFFECT$ 
 Effect on $TO$: $TO_EFFECT$
Creating a traderoute from $FROM$($GOODS_FROM$) to $TO$($GOODS_TO$) will, addition to $CASH$¤ each month, give $FROM$ $TO_EFFECT$ and $TO$ $FROM_EFFECT$.
To offer Tribute you must have a relation of at least -150 and we must both be at peace.
When we agree to pay tribute to another nation.
Do you wish to stop paying tribute to $COUNTRY$? \nThis will cause our relations to worsen and they will get a Casus Belli against us.
Do you wish to stop accepting tribute from $COUNTRY$?
Suggest that they pay tribute to us.
Do you wish to demand that $COUNTRY$ that country pays $CASH$¤ each month in tribute for our 'protection'?
$COUNTRY$ is asking us to pay a tribute of $CASH$¤ to them each month. By accepting, we will be considered to be under their protection.
This is a war that they have started.
This is a defensive war, where we need to help our ally.

With generals obsessing with their flanks it can perversely enough leave the army's centre venerable. An all out assault on the enemies centre can sometimes yield the same results as a flanking attack.
is equal to or less than
